Dialogue.NPCText:
The ancient ice encasing the woman shimmers with inner light. Cracks spiral across its surface. Her eyes—wide, luminous, unsettlingly aware—follow you with the patience of a glacier. A faint voice drifts into your mind, cold and clear.

"Traveler... I dream, but I am not asleep. I am Brenra, once daughter of Moonglow’s frost... now the memory of an age entombed. Why have you come to the edge of the world, where even memory shivers?"

Option.text: Are you... alive? Or something else?
What is this ice that holds you?
I seek knowledge, and perhaps to help you.
I was just drawn here, without knowing why.
Who were you before the ice?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Her lips do not move, but the words echo in your bones.
"Alive? I was. I am. I may be again. Aelric fears me, for he knows old stories—of how Minax’s shadow once tried to claim my soul and failed. Kaelen, dear reckless Kaelen, dreams of setting me free. But freedom is never simple in the cold. I remember every century. Every secret."

The ice flexes, creaking.
"If you would help me, you must first help them. And you must face the thing that prowls my frozen dreams..."

Option.text: Tell me of Aelric and Kaelen.
Why did Minax try to claim you?
This is too strange for me.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Her fingers twitch against the blue crystal.
"This is no mortal ice. It was forged in the Obelisk’s birth, in an age before men or paladins. It sings to Irinya in her sleep, and calls the Silent Hunter to my side each night. I am the vessel and the warden, and in my dreaming, the thing called FrozenBonefiend has grown strong..."

Option.text: What happens if the ice shatters?
Tell me about Irinya and the Silent Hunter.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Brenra’s voice stirs a chilly wind in your thoughts.
"Help comes in many forms. Aelric thinks to preserve me as a warning. Kaelen would risk all to thaw my heart. Irinya walks the spirit’s edge, warning that I may be a gate—an end, or a beginning. Will you help? Or will you run from the bone-chill of truth?"

Option.text: I will help, if you ask it.
I need to know more about your friends.
What is the bone-chill of truth?

Dialogue.NPCText: "Fate and frost entwine in Frostmere. Many who stand before the Obelisk are called, but few listen. Perhaps your soul echoes mine—caught between worlds, haunted by memories not your own. Will you share my burden, or will you flee into the snow?"

"Aelric is wise, but fear curdles his vision. He sees only risk—never renewal. Kaelen is fire in the frost, brave but blinded by longing for lost magics. Irinya and the Silent Hunter drift along the edge of dreams; they understand what it means to be a prison and a promise."
"Would you have me speak of them further, or would you carry my errand into the cold?"

Option.text: Tell me more of Irinya and the Silent Hunter.

Dialogue.NPCText: "Aelric was a child when the snows first sealed my fate. He is ancient now, but his soul grew old long before his bones. He keeps the council together, for good or ill. He wishes the world would leave its old ghosts buried. But ghosts do not rest—especially not in Frostmere."

"Kaelen is reckless, and perhaps that is why he will live when wiser men falter. He sees in me hope, not doom. If you would trust anyone with a broken secret, trust him. Yet, he may not survive the trial unless you stand beside him..."

Option.text: Tell me of Irinya and the Silent Hunter.

Dialogue.NPCText: "Irinya listens to the winds that coil around the Obelisk. Her soul is spun of prophecy and pain. She knows what hunts in the deep frost, and what it means when my hand shifts in the ice. The Silent Hunter follows her path; he is my shadow, but not my jailer. Listen to their warnings, but do not be ruled by fear."

Option.text: Tell me more about your errand.

Dialogue.NPCText: "Minax saw in me a wellspring—a soul twisted by winter, unbroken by her darkness. She sought to remake me as her instrument, but the Obelisk’s will is older and colder than her hate. Still, her followers return, gnawing at the bones of my dreams. One such horror crawls now in the snow outside Frostmere, gnawing the bones of the dead—will you end it?"

The ice groans, a haunting dirge.
"If the ice shatters unbidden, my prison fails—and the hunger beneath the world may wake. I am not its master, but I am its seal. The FrozenBonefiend yearns to break me, and if it succeeds, Frostmere will know a night without dawn."

Option.text: This is more than I can bear.

Dialogue.NPCText: "The bone-chill of truth is this: no magic can seal the world from darkness forever. Someone must always stand between hope and hunger. Will you face the nightmare on my behalf, or leave it to gnaw at the world’s edge?"

Option.text: I will do what must be done.

Dialogue.NPCText: "FrozenBonefiend—a corpse knotted with ancient ice, jaw full of memory, claws full of hunger. It crawls from the shadow of my own nightmare. It stalks the outskirts, stealing the breath from hearths and the marrow from the dead. Its malice grows with each dusk. Will you face it?"

Option.text: How can I find and defeat it?

Dialogue.NPCText:
The air grows colder. Brenra’s hand presses against the ice, fingers nearly free.
"The FrozenBonefiend nests in the hollow under Deadlight Ridge—where frost-lotus grows from bone and shadow. You must hunt it there. Beware: its breath is pure oblivion, and its touch will try to numb your will. Bring me the fragment of my lost soul it wears—a shard of crystal blue, caught in its ribs."

"If you succeed, I may remember more... or perhaps be one step closer to freedom—or destruction."

Option.text: I will hunt the Bonefiend and return the shard.
How will I know the shard?

Dialogue.NPCText: "Go now, and do not listen if the Bonefiend calls your name. The frost remembers all things, and so do I. Return to me with the shard, and I will share what wisdom remains in my waking heart."

Option.text: I will return with the shard.

Dialogue.NPCText: "South-east of the Obelisk, where the wind howls like a grieving widow and the snow never settles. The Ridge watches all who approach. Seek the bone cairn at its base; there, the shadow burrows deep."

Option.text: Thank you. I will hunt the Bonefiend.
I am not ready for this.

Dialogue.NPCText: "A splinter of memory and frost—clear as truth, cold as the void. It will gleam in the creature’s ribs, pulsing with pale blue light. Beware: the Bonefiend’s dying curse may cling to it still."

Option.text: This quest is too great for me.

Dialogue.NPCText: "If there was another way, I would beg it of you. But the world is cold, and the night is long. We must face our own shadows, or be devoured by them."

Option.text: Then I will do what must be done.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Her frozen eyes blink slowly, unnervingly human.

"Before the ice? A question not asked in a long while..."
A pause. The Obelisk hums faintly.

"I was born in Moonglow, in an age when the stars were brighter and magic knew shame. I studied not at the Lyceum, but beneath the glacial ruins of Tel'Anor. My focus was frostbinding—an art now banned. They said we ‘played with silence.’ And we did."

Option.text: You sound like you regret your power.
Magic often brings fear... and envy.

Dialogue.NPCText:
A whisper, sharp and brittle.

"Because frost remembers. It preserves what should decay. My peers feared that too deeply. They said our spells slowed the turning of fate, that we disrupted cycles. They were not wrong. But they were too afraid to wield the stillness."

Option.text: Tell me more about your family.

Dialogue.NPCText:
A hint of sorrow seeps through the frost.

"I regret nothing... except leaving my sister to the heat. Her name was Velexia. A fire mage. We argued endlessly, yet we were the same blood. When I chose exile to study the Obelisk... she chose war."

Option.text: Did you ever see her again?
Is that why you're so cautious now?

Dialogue.NPCText:
"Only once. She came north to find me, bearing wounds from Minax's beasts. We did not reconcile—but she gave me her flame pendant... a gift of warmth I cannot wear, only remember."

A faint pulse of blue light flickers in her robes.

She gestures, and a vision appears in your mind—
A bronze pendant shaped like a flame, spinning slowly in snow.

"This memory costs you nothing, yet it warms the soul."

"I had no children. No lover. My devotion was to study, to silence, to the geometry of stillness. My friends? Most were afraid of what I became. Except one..."

She trails off. The wind howls faintly through the trees.

Option.text: How does one devote themselves to stillness?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Her gaze sharpens, almost mischievous.

"His name was Elien. A cartographer of magic ley lines. He said the northern flows danced differently near me... but perhaps it was just poetry."
"He followed a ley line south... and never returned. Irinya says she hears his footsteps in the frozen valleys, but I believe that is her mercy speaking."

Option.text: I could search for his remains...

Dialogue.NPCText: "Emotion is dangerous, but necessary. The cold must not consume everything."

Option.text: You are not so cold, after all.
Let’s return to more urgent matters.

Dialogue.NPCText:
A thread of ice spins around your wrist.

"If you truly seek him... look in the Crystal Scar, west of the frozen mirror-lake. I felt his ley-sigil stir once beneath the frost there."

"You have warmth in you. Rare in this place."
She breathes—a fog curling from the ice.

"Take this... an ember of my sister’s fire, bound in frost."

"You know Tel'Anor?"
Her gaze sharpens, appraising.
"Then you know its library burned... and its mirror-vault was sealed. But not before I took what I needed. Three scrolls. One of them still sleeps beneath this ice."

Option.text: May I one day read it?

Dialogue.NPCText: "If I ever thaw... and you still draw breath... yes."

Option.text: Then I will see that day.
Let us speak of other things.

Dialogue.NPCText: A subtle nod. "Yes. Fear of what cannot be controlled. Envy of those who can wield stillness or fire, shadow or wind. We are the echoes of what they cannot touch."
